security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate code quality assurance tool. All 36 static findings are false positives: version numbers and URLs were incorrectly flagged as cryptographic algorithms, documentation example commands were flagged as shell execution threats, and role-play text was flagged as reconnaissance. The skill runs standard development checks in parallel with no malicious behavior.

content.user_title: Run instant code quality checks in parallel
content.value_statement: Code quality checks take too long and slow down development. Run theater detection, linting, security scans, and tests in parallel for instant feedback.
actual_capabilities: Detects placeholder code and TODOs in your codebase
Runs style audits for formatting and linting issues
Completes all checks in under 30 seconds
limitations: Quick mode skips deep analysis for speed
Requires external tools like linters to be installed
Basic test coverage only, not full test suite
Limited to files and directories you specify

best_practices: Run quick-quality-check before every commit to catch issues early
Set up as a pre-commit hook for consistent quality enforcement
Fix critical and high severity issues first, then address medium and low
anti_patterns: Ignoring medium and low severity issues long-term
Running on entire large codebase without file filters
Relying solely on quick mode for production release checks

faq.question: What is theater detection?
faq.answer: Theater detection finds placeholder code, mock data, TODO comments, and incomplete implementations.

faq.question: Can I run this on large codebases?
faq.answer: Yes, but use file filters or specific directories. Quick mode optimizes for speed over thoroughness.

faq.question: How does parallel execution work?
faq.answer: The skill spawns multiple agents that run different checks simultaneously for faster results.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only analyzes code locally. No code is sent to external services during quality checks.

faq.question: What if some checks fail?
faq.answer: The skill continues running other checks and reports all findings. Critical issues get escalated.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Combines multiple tools in parallel and provides a unified quality score with prioritized issues.
